The hotel is tastefully decorated, new, clean, large bathroom/shower, friendly staff, good breakfast, and the window opens for fresh air!  It is truly a lovely property and I highly recommend it. You can also walk to the large outlet mall with good restaurants.  You won't be disappointed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have to tell you this is a hotel collection that people should take notice of.   Great beds, excellent staff.   I had a good experience as a business traveler and would book again when returning to the area.   I will return!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review!  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you back soon!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: My stay at the Ayres hotel was wonderful. The food was great and fresh. The pool was sparkling and the gym had real weights, yeah! The bed was very comfortable and my room had a huge bathtub! I would definitely like to stay here again in the future
Manager Response: Dear Guest My staff and I appreciate your review of the Ayres Hotel Orange!  Thank you!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here numerous times. This time was for my 50th. As always, the staff greeted us in the beautiful lobby. Our suite was spotless and well appointed. We asked for late check out and it was not an issue. Overall, a 10 out of 10 experience, yet again!
Manager Response: Amy T thank you once again for your review, I really appreciate you taking your time to let us and others know of your great experience at the Ayres Hotel Orange!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Friendly and helpful staff, free and delicious breakfast with a great variety of food items (pancakes, bacon, eggs, cereal, baked goods!), convenient shuttle service ($5/day through ART), clean facilities, comfy beds, free parking, wifi. A really great place to rest up for your Disneyland adventure! I had gone to the wrong Ayres and the staff at the front desk was so nice that he offered to take me to the right Ayres branch free of charge! He helped me out so much just from his simple act of kindness!
Manager Response: Thank you Guest for taking the time to write a great review for the Ayres Hotel Orange!!  We appreciate your comments and will post your review along with all others in our Employee Break Area.  Again, thank you!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Very warm welcome from all staff.  Very clean and green minded.  I appreciated the warm cookies in the afternoon.  My wife loved the comfort of the bedding.  Did not care for the 18 wheeler tractor trailer parked in front of hotel or the 200 screaming students from Texas where they took over the lobby and dining area.  Otherwise, it was a nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for writing a wonderful review of the Ayres Hotel Orange; in spite of the 200 kids from Texas.  Being close to Disneyland we on occasion host high school groups from all over the US.  This was a particularly large group and we learned a few lessons that we will apply the next time we have groups; number one, book groups with smaller numbers.  Thank you for noting the comfortable rooms and cleanliness of the Hotel.  We hope to see you again in the future!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: My family and i booked at Ayres Orange on the recommendation of another family member who lives in town who said it was an excellent choice. We were not disappointed! the room was clean and large enough to be comfortable for a family of four. We loved that a full breakfast was provided until 10am, which is helpful for families with young children. The staff was attentive and helpful, whenever we needed them. The decor was pleasant and my kids loved the pool. And the price was reasonable. We will definitely stay at Ayres Orange when we return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and for acknowledging my staff's hard work in providing our guests with clean rooms, friendly caring service and a overall excellent experience!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Requested accessible room upon arrival discovered carpet was very wet front desk came and said the carpet was still drying and weren't lucky t be in a nice clean hotel. Said carpets were really clean and he could bring a fan. I told him he had no business renting a room where the carpet was wet. He said he would take it up with management
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for your review of the Ayres Hotel Orange.  I am so sorry your room had a damp carpet.  You had requested an accessible room, the carpet had a huge stain and unfortunately my Housekeeping staff miss-judged the time it would take for the carpet to dry after shampooing the carpet prior to your arrival.  Lesson learned; we should have let you know their was a stain from the  prior guest  and allowed you to choose to stay in the room or given you an alternative room to view.   I do appreciate you acknowledging the cleanliness of the hotel and room; and overall good experience.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: After a very positive experience at another Ayres property, we stayed at the one located in Orange. Upon arrival (after 3:00 p.m.), our room was not available; and the one in which we assigned did not have the combo bathtub/shower as indicated in the description. When we left the room the following morning, I had basically picked up the entire room in anticipation of housekeeping. It was apparent upon our return that the room had NOT been cleaned - just the bare essentials had been done, ie. replacing towels. The room had not been vacuumed, nor were the counter tops wiped down. There was a dish from breakfast that morning and an empty "to go" box that had not been removed by housekeeping. The following morning, I realized even the coffee and cups had not been replenished. When I
Manager Response: I had a letter from this guest yesterday and was able to call her and personally talk to her about her experience at the Ayres Hotel Orange.   I listened to her comments and was very embarrassed to agree that my staff in this instance dropped the ball all the way around.  There was no excuse for the lack of service extended so  I made one night of the stay complimentary.  She graciously has agreed to come back in the future and allow us to show her our normal great guest service.  I went on to hold a staff meeting going over the guest's comments so each department could work with their respective staff and learn from this incident.    Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Amazing stay. Had no idea that a full breakfast was included. That was a time saver and a very nice surprise. The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. And 5 pillows was a good thing to find in our room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are seasoned travelers and know what to expect at the high end resorts.  This was not the Four Seasons and that is reflected in the price.  The property is new and everything was in great shape as well as very clean.  If you want to be near Disneyland, and not expecting fine dining, need a big room because you have kids, then this is the place for you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I enjoyed our two night stay at the Ayres Orange that we are trying to make up a reason to revisit Orange County just so we can check-in your great establishment!     We had a great time at Ayres!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This place has a lot of potential but has too many faults to be nice.
Summary: Ayres Orange Hotel This place has a lot of potential but has too many faults to be nice.  From time to time I have to travel for my job and they ask me to visit places that are not promoted by the convention centers for future visits because they are cheaper.  I have been traveling more lately and use Trip Advisor a lot so I want to start contributing. This is my first review since my last trip and I have to say I think the Trip Advisor users have let me down on this one. This is not the worst hotel on the trip, I will save that one for my next review, but this is not the greatest hotel either. Let me first say that this place seems to have great potential. The place looks pretty good still because it is relatively new. There is a fireplace in the lobby, which I never got to use
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for taking time to review the Ayres Hotel Orange.  I first would like to invite you to call me  as I very surprised at your review and would like to talk to you personally.  I am only able to find one guest who checked into a room on the 4th floor for 4 nights the last three Saturdays.  If this was indeed yourself, your request to be roomed on the top floor of the hotel was met, the hotel is only 4 stories tall.  As far as parties, the hotel has not booked any parties in our breakfast room.  It may have been a large family or wedding group but we received no other complaints or comments over the last 5 weeks about excessive noise.  Our security reports show there were no calls to the front desk to quell any disturbances during your stay.  I have also reviewed all messages, saved and deleted from our Housekeeping Manager's phone and found all return calls were made to all messages left.  At his point I again ask that you call me personally as I would like to sort out your review.  I also encourage you as I do all guests to contact management immediately during a hotel stay so we may resolve any issues and ensure our guests are taken care.  Thank you.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Friendly, clean, quiet with comfortable beds
Summary: We stayed here 4 nights and slept great. The hotel is quiet and the beds are very comfortable. The room is large so there is space for you and your luggage. The WiFi is good and there are plenty of plugs including USB ports for charging all your electronic toys. Breakfast is a full breakfast, eggs, bacon, pancakes, toast and cereal along with coffee, juice or milk. We enjoyed having a fridge in the room. It allowed us to keep our late night snacks nice and cool. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I spoke with them multiple times both before and during our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you so much for your great review of the Ayres Hotel Orange, we really appreciate your acknowledgement of our hard work!!  We do hope to see you int he future!  Sincerely,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: This hotel is awesome and very clean.  The breakfast is great and so are the afternoon cookies.   I have never seen the staff clean the way, they do at this hotel.  They take pride in making sure the guest are comfortable.  I relaxed my OCD on cleanliness at this hotel.  I felt I could walk in the room with my shoes off.  Great price and service.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your kind review and noting the pride my staff takes in providing the the highest level of cleanliness possible.  I will be posting your comments, as I do all guest comments, in our employee lounge so that all staff can see how their hard work is appreciated by our guests. Again, thank you!  Sincerely, Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: I was in town for a convention and stayed at this hotel.  While it is not walking distance to the venue, it is an excellent hotel, quite, not filled with kids, great  free breakfast buffet, and overall very good staff. Rooms are extremely nice, super clean, and comfortable.   I had one issue the hotel and they were extremely responsive and handled it well!
Manager Response: Thank you guest, for posting your review on Trip Advisor!  I was pleased to hear that my staff was responsive to your needs, and that the hotel was the perfect spot to stay while you attended your conference.   While it may be awhile before you will be in the Anaheim Orange area again, we look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip. Again, thank you!  Sincerely, Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Always where we stay when visiting daughter at college
Summary: I really like the Ayres Hotel. The only reason it lost a point was it's right near a hospital and you will hear sirens a lot!  It's new, has nice size rooms, a good work out room, a clean pool and hot tub and includes a hot breakfast that's good. We always choose this hotel when visiting our daughter at Chapman University and extra bonus they give a Chapman parent discount!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed for an extended period of time on a business trip, and spent a fair bit of time in my hotel room working.  The hotel was in very good condition, pretty much brand new.  The room I had was large and well appointed.  In spite of the location very near 2 freeways, it was extremely quiet. It was a bit pricey considering the location, but I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you so much for your kind words, we really appreciate knowing our quiet rooms gave you a comfortable place to work and be productive.  We do hope to see you in the future and don't forget to check our website for special rates and packages for your next visit.  Sincerely,  Christine Smith General manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel was an easy place to stay while visiting the Orange County area.  It was clean, quiet, large room and had a comfortable bed.  I also liked all the pillows (4 full sized pillows on the kings bed).  I liked the spacious shower and multiple shelving in shower.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for taking the time to let us know how much you enjoyed the Ayres Hotel Orange.  Yes the fireworks you heard were either from Disneyland or the Angels Stadium, which is also conveniently located near the hotel.  Hope to see you back soon!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel Orange was a pleasant stay. Convenient to many attractions, the free breakfast was great and the major advantage was free parking. Not many hotels in the Disneyland area offer free parking. Highly Recommended. Minor drawback was the pool only opened in the daytime
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank your for your kind review, my staff always appreciate knowing that guests enjoyed their stay with us!  I am sorry if we did not communicate our pool hours correctly, the pool and jacuzzi are open from 10 am - 10 pm for our guest's enjoyment.  Please do visit us the next time you are in our area.  Again, thank you!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: A Great Place for a Out of Town Meeting
Summary: In the past 10 years of planning and holding the Really Motivated Chocolate Franchisee Conference, The Ayers Hotel is by far, my favorite place.   My group felt very taken care of, and Rose Guerrier is the best sales personnel I have ever dealt with. She was attentive, checking on us several times throughout the day, and made sure we had everything we needed.   The sleeping rooms were beautiful, clean and most importantly....comfortable.  Our catered meals were delicious, and at least 5 people told me how good the food was. I appreciated the complimentary amenities that so many big hotels change for to the point of not making meetings affordable.   So thank you for the free parking, the free wifi, the free breakfast, and the afternoon wine break, and accepting my packages for
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family member was at the hospital nearby and I needed a place to rest and let my baby sleep without the baby being in a car seat all day. The room was clean & beds extremely comfortable. I recommend this particular location to anyone. They even had fresh baked cookies in the foyer!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Getting into the hotel was a little challenging!  But once we figured out, much easier next time.  The parking was nice.  Check-in went smooth.  A large bowl of oranges welcomed us along with orange water. Our room was very nice...plenty of space!  Bed was very comfy!  Had a great night of sleep!!  Quiet!  Breakfast in the morning was very good!  Will use this hotel brand again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was running the Disneyland half marathon and needed a hotel that was close by Disneyland that was affordable.  It's not walking distance to Disneyland but just a shuttle ride away.  It was Labor Day weekend at the time and every hotel around the are was pretty much booked and so I decided to use Hotwire.  I clicked that button for it to pick a hotel and it's like gambling on a slot machine!!  It's a thrill those few seconds waiting for it to choose your hotel and in the end I ended up with the Ayres Hotel in Orange.  I thought I hit the jackpot.    I emphasize the Orange location because my friend also booked at Ayres however the Anaheim location and I've got to say that the difference between these two hotels is like night and day.  That can be a separate review.  Location is
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Ayers Hotel in Orange for the Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend. Nice hotel, very clean, incredibly nice and very efficient staff, free parking, easy ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) to Disneyland, extremely easy access to the I-5 freeway, zero complaints.  I would have never chosen to stay at this hotel since it's not within a reasonably walkable distance to Disneyland, but was given this hotel through a Priceline bid.  I'm so thankful my options have been expanded because I would definitely stay here again if the price were right.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: After about 20 different hotels near Disneyland, we have a winner!
Summary: Yes, it is in Orange, not Anaheim or Garden Grove. It is 3 mins from the hotel lobby to the Harbor Dr exit on the I-5 (Disneyland's fastest route to Mickey & friends parking).  Other reviews note how new and perfect this hotel is in the big and little things. It is all true! All properties in the shadow of Disneyland know they provide service on a higher level, whether it is a 2-star mom and pop motel, or a 4-star luxury hotel. Crowning this hotel as the best out of about 20 that we have stayed in and reviewed near DL is not a thing I do lightly. Because it is the best, I will share what blew me away and one thing that almost had me stomp out before seeing my room.  1) The beds are as comfortable as possible (subjective, I know). As I say in most of my reviews, the bed is
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Wow, you blew us away with your review, thank you so much for acknowledging my staff's hard work and dedication to making the Ayres Hotel Orange a special place to stay!  And thank you for letting us know while you were in-house about the error my clerk made regarding the credit card approval.  I am so sorry it happened but we have used the incident as a "teaching moment" not only for the clerk in question but as a reminder for all desk staff on how to correctly handle this procedure.  We do hope to see you the next time you are in the area!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We love this place!  So clean and well maintained.  Clean linens and towels, and very quiet rooms.  Very responsive front desk staff.  Good breakfast.  I hope they continue to maintain these high standards.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very happy we chose this hotel ! The location was great- very close to Disneyland. Our room was very clean- newer everything! Overall the hotel is very clean and comfortable. The only thing I found a bit disappointing was the breakfast . More options- rotation would be awesome.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our second time staying @ the Ayres Hotel Orange. It's just a lovely hotel that feels like home. The staff is helpful & attentive. The rooms are very clean & the furnishings  are new. The decor in the lobby has a peaceful Zen like vibe.  They have all the amenities:  free parking, breakfast, nice toiletries, cookies in the evening, a small guest/gift shop & more!  We are booked to return in October for our son's wedding.  Best place to stay in Orange.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Dropped our child off at Chapman. Rooms are large, and I like the 1/4 wall between the two queen beds. Bathroom was roomy. The hotel allowed us to ship boxes to them and that was very helpful. The outlet mall is 1/2 mile down the street. Breakfast in the morning was helpful. Cookies in the evening were nice as we were starving. We will return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was everything we could have wanted in a place to stay.  It was beautifully decorated, clean, modern, and comfortable.  Though we were a little bit farther away from where we visited than other hotels, it was easy to get back and forth.  We thoroughly enjoyed a hot breakfast each morning, and it was served until 10 every morning, allowing for someone to sleep in!  The desk clerks/supervisors went above and beyond during our stay, as we had a little issue needing their assistance.  I cannot say enough good things about Ayres Hotel Orange.  I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Did not get what we asked for, responded to GM letter, no response...rooms are nice, property clean...we are upset that we have to go elsewhere next trip...saw a couple places when we left?..thats all!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel.  Very nice staff.  Easy to get to
Summary: This is our second year staying at this hotel.  Last year, we were the VERY FIRST guests at the hotel.  We loved the place then and made plans to return the next year during our annual trek to OC.  If you go, be sure to say Hi to Christine, the hotel manager. She is very nice.  Rooms are very spacious and have tall ceilings.  Super clean.  Still smells like a new hotel - it's only a year old.  Breakfast is good.  The cooks are in the restaurant and you can see them cooking up the bacon, eggs, pancakes, etc, so you know its fresh.  Milk is really fresh too.  They have a pool, but we didn't use.  Rather, we drove down to the beaches in Newport and Laguna.  Not that far of a drive.  The hotel is conveniently located right on I5, so you can go pretty much anywhere from there.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family loved staying with you! It was the perfect location for visiting the beach and the theme park. Very clean and spacious rooms. Breakfast was great. We would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved this hotel. it is fantastic. the location, the amenities, the rooms, but MAINLY... the staff.  Upon arriving - the free parking, there are lots of spaces - the welcoming staff and lobby are delightful... they have fresh baked cookies daily for guests in the evening.  Jennifer checked us in and without any exaggeration, she was the most impressive welcome desk operator and hotel staff member that we have ever experienced.   Me & my (new) wife have travelled the world and enjoyed luxurious establishments, but she is without doubt the most delightful, helpful and lovely hotel staff member we have ever encountered. She couldn't do enough for us... she added extra little magic touches throughout our stay (a bottle of wine and welcome note to the room, free beers after their
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Family get together fro the OC Fair and Disneyland
Summary: Excellent, excellent to bad we never had time for the great cookies, the staff were very helpful and friendly. Then grandkids enjoyed the Disney firework show from the window of our rooms and they like the breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really enjoyed my 3 day stay in Orange. The property was well managed, with a nice lobby area to relax and drink a cup of coffee. The pool was a little on the small side, but did the trick just fine. The hotel is located near a mall, so there are plenty of stores and restaurants in the area. I considered this stay to be an excellent value for the $.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: great price for a brand new hotel
Summary: Made a quick trip to Disneyland last week just before the start of school. The hotel we would like to stay at was booked up therefore we were forced to search else where and quite a surprise that be stumble upon this brand new hotel with such reasonable price. It's right off of highway 5 and 2 exits away from Disneyland. It's right across the UC Medical Hospital and nearby shopping and restaurants. There is another location in Anaheim but for some reason, that one charges for parking (understandably it's across the Honda coliseum) as oppose to this one- it's free parking. They serve free breakfast. Pretty decent, enough choices to fill your tummy before the big calorie burning theme park exploration.  Front desk were very friendly and courteous. Lobby is uber clean, pool is mall

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for our Disneyland Trip
Summary: Anytime we visit Southern California, we stay in an Ayres hotel.  The Ayres are high quality hotels with reasonable rates and the Ayres in Orange is perfect for our trips to Disneyland.  They provide a wonderful breakfast and use of the ART is convenient.  Shopping and several restaurants are also located nearby.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can't say enough good things about this Ayres property in Orange. It is extremely well run (and I have pretty high expectations for efficiency and quality), the room we had was fantastic and very large, the staff are all extremely helpful, and the hotel's location was perfect for so many things we wanted to do.  We stayed primarily to move my daughter into Chapman University, but we also went to an Angel's game, drove to Hollywood, went to the beach, and did a lot of shopping. It was just right for everything. We walked to Angel stadium in 20 minutes, we drove to Hollywood in 30 minutes, and the same for the beach.  The hotel has plenty of good restaurants around it, and lots of shopping for fun and for college necessities  :)  From the moment we arrived, the staff was

Summary: The hotel was very clean, my room was very spacious and had a microwave and mini fridge.  The bathroom had a garden tub that was very nice.  Complimentary full breakfast was good and very convenient.  The staff was also very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is really nice and clean. Very close to some activities. And really great location to move around O.C. and Anaheim. The staff were helpful and nice. The included breakfast was fine. Would return any time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a week for business, and the hotel raised it to pleasure as well. The hotel is fairly new, under a year. The entire hotel is kept very clean. A hearty hot serve-yourself breakfast is available each morning. Mattress, pillows, and linens are nice quality. Bedrooms are quiet. In other words, you sleep well. The pool and hot tub are nice - plus, there are lovely outdoor couches under umbrellas for comfortable places to relax outside. Freshly baked cookies are available every evening. Beer, wine, and soft drinks are provided Monday-Thursday. If we return to the area, we're staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My brother-in-law and I went to see the Orioles play the Angels in Anaheim.  It is about a 12 to 15 minute walk to the ballpark - very easy.  The hotel is remodeled and is excellent. It had a great room (two queen beds with a 5 foot partition in between), great breakfast and friendly staff.  Would absolutely stay here again for business or pleasure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location for visiting Chapman University.  Soothing decor, large bathroom, lots of storage and easy parking. Unfortunately found someone's sock under one of the beds. Bed was a bit lumpy.  Check in staff extremely professional and courteous.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is beautiful. Yes it is "you get what you pay for." So you pay a little more......so worth it. Nice and clean (all except for the hairball in the towel I unfolded to throw on the ground outside the shower) which wasn't a big deal because we bring our own towels due to our kids having allergies. Everything is new. Beds are comfy (we have temperpedics at home so we always fear sleeping on hotel beds) but they were good. Everything is conveniently located (ice machine, washer and dryer). Very close to ANGELS stadium and Disneyland . It's nice and quiet here. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The free breakfast was awesome. Seriously pancakes, sausage, potatoes, eggs, fruit, yogurt, toast, danishes, and variety of beverages etc. I mean, I have no
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent service, front desk handled every request we had and in a very professional manner.  The breakfast was free and delicious.  I really felt that this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in in the last few years.  Thanks
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice location, clean room and new property. We stayed for one night in early August 2015. The room was very clean and beds comfortable. The best hotel we stayed during the trip (6 hotels in ca) and cheapest. Great value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Unfortunately there was a drunk wedding party that decided it would be okay to bring the party to the room next door at midnight. It felt like they were in our room. Other than the noise factor, you couldn't ask for a nicer place to stay. Very pretty.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The entire hotel sparkled from the color palate throughout the hotel, cleanliness, convenient amenities, and great parking.  The theme park was not part of our visit, but we noted bus pick up outside the lobby.   Our room had a wonderful floor plan with the sink outside the shower area.  Adjacent the sink was an additional large counter space.  Perfect for  sharing a room. It is located conveniently across the street from The Irvine Medical center. A wonderful restaurant, Acapulco, is easily walking distance along with several fast food places.  Close by is a movie theater and outlet stores. We will stay here again when in the area.

Summary Heading: Disappointing, when I expect only the best from Ayres!
Summary: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are large and well appointed but when we arrived we found the past owners belongings in the closet and hairs in the sink and bathtub. The second day only one bed was made up and our towels were a mess. Though we did not tell them to wash the sheets, we expected the beds to be made. It seemed like someone was cutting corners. And we even left a nice tip! The breakfast area is wonderful and large but they need to bus the tables more and clean up the area around the hot food. It looked like someone had had a food fight there. Other than that, the staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is new, nice and super clean. Check in & out take 2 minutes, The rooms were very bright, spacious, a lot of counter space & nice paint colors and decorate make it feels very comfortable.  Nice decorate and very big comfortable bed. Big sofa and flat screen TV with some HBO...Cinema...Bathroom was big and super clean, the bath tub was huge, nice mirror of make-up area. In room have refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and very good WiFi.

Summary: stay was excellent. would like it if breakfast started at 6:00 since the training class we attend starts at 7 and it is about 9 miles away. other then that hotel and grounds are great. we always stay at the ayers at mills mall and that is what attracted us to you

Summary: Great hotel near Disney Downtown! Great for staying with kids. Room was confortable and good space for a Family of 4.Staff has provided great servisse. They provide a good breakfast in the morning. It was a great value for the price.

Summary Heading: One night knott's berry farm stay
Summary: Great hotel but pricey. Don't like how u have to go up far to make a u turn to get into the parking lot though. Great breakfast and close to parks. Booked up so late check out not allowed. Overall good
Manager Response: none

Summary: As always my recent stay was excellent. The staff was pleasant and friendly even when they were swamped. They also experienced a power outage and handed it with being professional. I would recommend this hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel, which seemed like the typical "Off the freeway, pull over and spend the night but don't expect too much" type, over delivered with a quality staff, ultra-clean property, and a hot breakfast that included hot cakes coming off the griddle right onto your plate.  Solid gym and pool area as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: To start it off we went to take family down to happiest place on earth ... Disneyland. We get to hotel and get greeted by very unfriendly and rude employee Christopher. He was very unpleasant to deal with. We got checked in later that day to find ants all of the counters. That was pretty bad. For the money we paid we were sadly disappointed. Also this hotel is pretty far from disneyland. You have to take art transportation over and back to hotel. After a long day at disneyland a forty minute ride back to hotel is not ideal. Breakfast was okay for hot breakfast but not much variety. We will not be staying at this hotel ever again very inconveinant. We dont deserve rude staff on our well needed family vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you Kristie for posting.  In your initial comments directly  to the Hotel you did not mention a problem with ants but in researching your stay I found that you did have ants in your room.  Maintenance did spray and we did move you to another room upon your request.  I am sorry that you had to go through this experience.  Below is my emailed response to you prior to knowing about the ants.  "Thank you, I appreciate you getting back to me and providing further feedback.  As the hotel's manager it is my responsibility to ensure my staff is warm, welcoming and helpful to our guests and your feedback allows me the opportunity to work with Christopher.  He is one of our best clerks and noted for his friendliness, having a "bad day" is not acceptable from my prospective.  I will be handling the situation."  I will also be providing an adjustment to your room bill.  I have called Getaway Today and have asked them to do a refund to your credit card.  Christine Smith

Summary: Cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in.  Nice size room and bathroom.  Great location to I5 for getting around OC. if you are planning on going to Disney it is a good location as well as taking in an Angels game.  Close but not in the bustle of the Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Brand new Ayres Hotel Right by the 5 freeway Perfect for Disneyland ! Complimentary breakfast if you are up in time ! Microwave and fridge for snacks as no room service in this hotel ! Close to Orange Outlet mall to keep mum happy ! To be recommended
Manager Response: none

Summary: The people are so nice and welcoming.I stay there weekly and the concierge are so nice and even saved me cookies. Being a loyal customer, they upgraded my room to a suite and it is so homey, which made it feel like my home away from home
Manager Response: none

Summary: We extended our trip from san diego to see the angels game and ended the trip amazingly with a beautiful room and amazing staff that helped with even planning a last minute trip to disneyland for the day
Manager Response: none

Summary: They had the best service along with friendly employees.  Beautiful hotel with heated pool and free parking.  A buffet breakfast every morning and open dining room!  Outlet on the Orange is close by along with a 24 hour Krispie kremes.  Everything's is a close distance!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had  a very good experience at the new hotel Ayres orange and would recommend it as well as stay there again. We booked three rooms for a small group of us and we all were satisfied. Cute boutique hotel where all your needs will be met.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for Angels game
Summary: My family and I stayed there July of this year. We walked to the Angels game in about 15 minutes with ease. Not fancy but rooms are clean, staff is helpful and breakfast buffet better than expected. Good family stay for Disney or the Angels.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was great....clean, new and modern.  Oversized rooms and beautiful bathrooms.  The morning complementary breakfast was good...eggs, bacon, pancakes, hash browns, pastries, fresh fruit and yogurt.  You have free parking and wifi.  There is a shuttle that takes to from the hotel to Disney as many times as you like in a day it was $5.00. I will stay here next time we come to Disney!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel!  Immaculate, nice large rooms and free parking. Small parking garage located adjacent to hotel. Hotel is within walking distance of shopping, dining, and Angel Stadium. Nice pool area and hot breakfast option. Great value for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm being honest here, do not stay here and expect the Ritz Carlton. We just needed a bed to sleep in and a simple breakfast in the morning it completely met our expectations. Ayres is a solid option for those who shop in this price range. The service and staff are nice and the property is kept clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel while going to Disneyland
Summary: Very spacious and clean room. Pillows and bed were comfy... Great location...outlets and restaurants and Church...Lots of parking spots available and NO parking fee. Good distance from Disneyland Park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After searching for a hotel in Anaheim, I was tipped by my sister to pick this hotel, and surely glad that I did! It's a beautiful new property, conviniently located, has plenty of parking, and best of all breakfast is included! I would have rated it 5 stars except black hair were left on my vanity after housekeeping!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the first time we stayed at an Ayers properties.  Our room at the Ayers Orange was spacious, clean, and comfortable.  The layout of the room is much better than your typical hotel room with two queen beds.  If you and your are vacationing in the Disneyland  area, this would be a good place to stay to offers good accommodation, buffet breakfast, convenient shuttle to Disneyland, and easy access to the freeway.  We would definitely  add this hotel to our preferred accommodations list and would stay here again. Kudos to the staff.  They were all wonderful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location off I-5! Great Service, Staff was very professional! Free WIFI was a great amenity!  Free Breakfast was great, and tasty! Rooms were clean, spacious, and very comfortable! Will go back anytime I 'm in the area!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Completely Remodeled with Lots of Extras Included
Summary: If you're looking for a hotel close to Disneyland that doesn't charge you extra for breakfast, wifi or parking, and you're somewhat of a hotel snob like me, I would definitely recommend Ayres Hotel Orange. The rooms and bathrooms seem like they are brand new. The rooms are very nice-sized with plenty of room on counters/furniture for stuff. Loved that our room came with microwave and refrigerator. So many extras without the extra cost. Book it now!
Manager Response: none

Summary: So, this is my second time using the Ayer's chain while staying in Southern California.  This time I took the family, and was again not disappointed in the cleanliness, service and location.  Close to many amenities, shopping and of course Disneyland.  You can't go wrong with having the ART shuttle to and from.  Worth the money and less of a headache looking for parking (costly).  The only difference with this location is the breakfast selection was not as good as the Laguna Woods hotel.  Not with standing that difference, the family enjoyed the stay and comfort of the hotel. Parking lot/garage is free but shared by their sister hotel on the property.  Next SoCal trip, Ayer's would be in our minds for accommodations.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The front desk was very friendly and helpful on arrival. The lobby was new and the rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean.  The breakfast was included and a good start to the day. Great shopping close by and a Starbucks just down the street.  Thank you Ayres.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Looks like a brand new hotel with a fresh reception area and large comfortable rooms.  My room had both a microwave and fridge which was a great benefit.  Free parking and free wifi just make this a real winner.  In the hotel next door is a French / Mexican restaurant and the food is outstanding!   Bus to Disney leaves from just outside the hotel next door too.  The area is great with a massive outlet mall in walking distance with so many food options.  I would stay again for sure.  Finally, staff were all very pleasant - hotel has a boutique feel about it
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great location for Disneyland, sports like hockey or the stadium. It is very new and in great conditions.the rooms are well equipped like coffee maker, microwave, nice shower and plenty of TV channels. The complimentary breakfast is great to have , but i wish there would be a 24hr room service. Fantastic beds, pillows and bedding.overall a great lace to stay

Summary Heading: Family vacation stay at Aryes Orange
Summary: In overall, this hotel was a good experience except for poor quality mattresses and dusty hairy carpet floor. Good location and friendly staff. Free breakfast good was good quality and dining area was clean.

Summary Heading: Could not have been more pleased!
Summary: We visit Disneyland often, and have never found a hotel that we love enough to stay at twice.  Ayres Orange has changed that!  While everything was great, the thing that stood out most to me was the feeling of not being crowded at all, which is really nice when you spend all day shoulder to shoulder at Disneyland.  Whether we were at the pool, Happy Hour in the lobby, the free hot breakfast, the parking lot out front, the parking garage behind the building, or at the elevators, we never got that packed in feeling.    I can't say the same for the Grand Californian when we walked through this trip, or when we have stayed there in the past.  The convenience is just not worth that $500 price tag or the sardine feeling.  The rooms were spacious with awesome tub and shower, and I
Manager Response: none

Summary: The beds are amazing. Perfect in every way. Kids loved it here. It was a really nice place without too many bells and whistles. We felt welcomed and comfortable from the start. Location is great. Shuttle to Disneyland is super simple and convenient. (though there is a small fee as it's run by the city, not hotel).
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our favourite hotel we stayed at for our California trip. The room was spacious for a family of four, well lit everywhere, new and clean feel throughout, staff was helpful, breakfast was good, and what a convenient location.  Better than any Anaheim hotel in the same class and close to Orange outlet for shopping. If all hotels were like this one.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at 4 different hotels in California during our trip, and this one was the best by far.  We actually messed up our reservations and scheduled only Tuesday and Wednesday when we also needed Monday, and they were very accommodating when we arrived early.  The breakfast was good, and I liked the perks of the free refreshments between 5 and 7 pm.  The fitness center was adequate for the size of the hotel, and our kids loved the pool and hot tub.  Everyone was friendly, and the location was convenient to both Disneyland and the Angels.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was very pleasant to stay at Ayres Hotel Orange.  The hotel is very clean.  The room is roomy and smells very fresh.  Bed and sofa are very comfortable. Very good continental breakfast.  The staff is excellent, very friendly and helpful.  The location is perfect to many attractions in Anaheim, especially Disneyland, and it is within walking distance to the Outlet with many shops, restaurants and movie theater.  Will certainly come back again on our next trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel in orange county right off the 5 and close to Disneyland. Self parking and there's a shuttle ($) that takes you to Disneyland that stops at this hotel. The free breakfast actually served hot food and it was really nice and quiet. We did not go to Disneyland but I would consider this hotel the next time I head to OC for a Disney trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable Beds and nice friendly service.
Summary: You can tell that Hotel Ayres is run very well. If you are looking for comfortable beds and nice rooms this place is great. The pool isn't very large and its a little close to the highway but overall it was very nice. I would go back.

Summary: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is very clean and new. It is very close to Disney land. The free breakfast was great for a family. My kids also loved the cookies every afternoon. You can't get a better hotel for the price paid!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 3 nights here for my daughters birthday trip to Disneyland at the end of June.   Check in was fine, I had to wait for a bit while the front desk handled other customers, once it was my turn it was fairly easy but she went to helping someone else that showed up before I had a chance to finish asking questions and get the keys for the scooter that had been dropped off for us to use.   The room was large and well appointed, needed to dust a bit but otherwise it worked perfectly for the three of us. The  "dream" beds were a more like a nightmare, I have never been on such a springy bed before - every time my husband rolled over I was launched off the bed. The  sofa bed was so uncomfortable that my daughter chose to sleep on the couch, the "leather" covering on the couch made
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent two very pleasant nights at the The Hotel Ayres.  Room was very comfortable and clean.  Exercise facility was very adequate as was the free breakfast.  Had made reservations for 5 nights but circumstances required  that I check out early.  At 10 AM I advised the front desk that I needed to check out early-- no penalty with the early check out--  This is the second time I stayed at this property and I experienced the same small problem both times.  Attempts to purchase water from the little store thingy was a long drawn out process to the point where I gave up.  At check in I did purchase a bottle of water without any problem but when trying to purchase ar other tiems I just gave up
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff helpful & knowledgeable, rooms very nice and liked that they were a bit larger  size than many other hotel rooms, beds very comfortable, also added plus having shower & toilet separate from the vanity area.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you very much for your review, I really appreciate the time our guests take to let us know about their stay.  We hope to see you again in the future!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location a fine hotel except for cleanliness
Summary: Lots of hair in bath tub ugh!              The room was attractive and comfortable.  If cleanliness is addressed by management it would be quite good! Amenities and food are vey good. The location is very convenient, especially if you have a medical appointment nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you guest for reviewing the Ayres Hotel Orange and giving us your feedback.  I am so sorry that our level of cleanliness slipped a bit.  We have several new room attendants who we are diligently working with to bring their skills up the Ayres Hotel's standards.  I take your comments seriously and will be inspecting more rooms each time to continue to improve our guest satisfaction.  Again, Thank you!!  Christine Smith

Summary: This place was perfect. It's was clean and the customer service was excellent. Would expect to pay more than we did. Breakfast was good and they have a little shop in case you forget to bring essentials. Bathtub was huge and made my day after 3 in a row 12 hour days at Disneyland. The ART shuttle picks up in the same parking lot and the hotels sell the discount daily tickets. No issue with freeway noise which was a huge plus as I'm a light sleeper. My only irritation was being questioned upon check out regarding my rate. I am a government employee and presented my ID upon check in and felt offended that I was being questioned upon check out like I was trying to scam the system.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for your great review!  but also let me apologize for my staff questioning your Government rate at check-out.  Nothing should have been said as we always check Government ID at check-in and I will remind all staff of this.  I am so happy that the hotel worked so well for you and your family and we hope to see you in the future!!  Christine Smith

Summary: My wife needed to attend a conference and we brought the family down from Oakland.  The facilities are top-rate, the service and attention to detail was outstanding -- this include the complimentary breakfast which is a rarity.  We'll not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is brand new so the rooms are immaculate,  my favorite is the huge bathroom area and shower. Hotel staff are friendly,  check in was quick and we were able to get an early check in which was great since we had driven down from Washington state.  The only minor complaint I would have would be the breakfast selection,  I know that other hotels in the area offer bigger breakfast selections but still not a huge deal for us. The shuttle TO the park is quick as there is only 1 stop between the hotel and DL but the ride back is really long with a lot more stops.  The shuttle is separate from the hotel so it's not their fault but just a note for those catching the shuttle. Overall a good stay at a decent price for a brand new hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is really nice and close to Disneyland  Easy on of freeway access The staff is very friendly as well The rooms are clean and spacious and the price is good for this area.  The ayers in Anaheim was very rude to me in the phone so I will only stay at this one going forward .
Manager Response: none

Summary: I really liked this hotel.  Very convenient to all the attractions and the airport.  Disneyland is 10 minutes away if you are going.  My room was very large and newly renovated.  The bed was very comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again.  All the staff was really friendly and fresh baked cookies were awesome!!!

Summary: Everything was so good in this hotel but I face a problem with the address it wasn't updated with Google maps or any GPS programs even when I order from restaurants  it was hard to explain the address for delivery  while I give them the address like the front desk  write it to me .

Summary: HAd the pleasure of being able to stay the night at this hotel.  From the outside it looks like a regular but from the inside it was really nice.  Rooms were good and staff was courteous and the complimentary hot breakfast buffet was good.

Summary: All staff were very polite & curious. Breakfast area was all neat & tidy Everything was great. We enjoyed our stay there. looking forward to go back to any of your hotel in near & distance future.  Thank you.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here as we were going to Disneyland, it was an amazing high-class hotel. The room was in excellent condition, The hotel breakfast was amazing, and the housekeeping was out of this world. The best part was a hot chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. If you're staying at Disneyland make sure you stay here

Summary: Had my three month post op appointment at UCI in Orange. I've st stayed here 2 times before. The staff is great and very kind.  Had a room out on the patio. It was nice. It's also close to Disneyland and the Orange outlet mall.

Summary: Great hotel!  We stayed there when going to an Angel Game.  My husband made a mistake with our resveration but the hotel manager was GREAT to fix it for us!  THANKS!  I initially was afraid when I saw it was across the street from a hospital.  ZERO noise at night!

Summary: We wanted to stay near CHOC because our granddaughter had surgery and had to stay over. The hotel is beautiful, room was spacious, service was great and breakfast was delicious. Overall a great place to stay!

Summary Heading: A lovely, clean and quiet hotel
Summary: My husband and I stayed with our 8month old daughter.   Check in was super quick and easy. Requested a crib and they immediately brought it to the room however the guy just put it in the corner and left, didn't build it for us, didn't bring a sheet to go with it just left. After my husband built it he went to reception to request a sheet and was given one straight away.  The room was lovely, clean and we had lots of room. The bathroom had a deep tub which I liked. The hotel was quiet, we couldn't hear traffic outside or any other guests. The room was nice and dark with thick drapes.   Breakfast is served in a beautiful room, it has lots of character and looking out to the pool. Breakfast was good. 3 cereals, yoghurt and chopped fruit, pancakes, egg and sausage, 3 types of bread
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just a one-night stay, but very impressed with the room - nicely decorated, comfortable and clean.  Nice touch is the homemade cookies in the lobby each afternoon.  Staff very nice and accommodating. Only thing slightly disappointing was the free breakfast.  However, how can one complain when it was free and served in a nice setting.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My sister and I stayed at Ayres Hotel while in town for business. It's in a great location.  The staff were wonderful.  They could not have been more friendly, accommodating, or helpful.  My sister and I could not have had a successful trip without the staff. The hotel is by far the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. The rooms were roomy and extremely well kept.  I will never stay in another hotel in Orange County.

Summary Heading: Can't go wrong!  Great place to stay!!
Summary: This hotel is so comfortable, and the staff is wonderful.  We stayed with a large group for a high school baseball tournament and we were all treated like royalty. Will definitely be back!!  Thank you!!

Summary: We stayed here for three nights. This is the perfect place to recover from jet lag and to use as a base for exploring Anaheim. Yes, there are other hotels that are better positioned for the theme parks, but I've stayed in them and they can be super-busy and less peaceful.   The room is well appointed, and the room interior is quiet -no sound of passing traffic at all.  There is a refreshing pool and a smaller hot pool next to it.  My wife and granddaughter spent several hours enjoying the pool.  Breakfast is basic but it's good and we enjoyed eating here each morning.  Reception is super-friendly and super- efficient. The reception area is a nice place to sit while waiting for the shuttle to the parks.    The wifi is free and fast.   We would be very happy to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay the staff goes above and beyond to make you feel at home
Summary: I travel for work often and will only stay at the Ayres Hotel in Orange. The rooms are clean with a great big tub to soak away all the stress from the day. More than that is the welcoming staff willing to go the extra mile. From Jennifer at the front desk who always has a smile to Jhoanna making sure your stay is perfect they make this property special. Your exceptional all of you Thank You. Jeannette M

Summary: Very nice stay, excellent hotel! Staff is friendly. Front desk very helpful. The rooms are very nice and clean. I got a room with 2 queen beds and I liked the way they separated with  a built in patrician in the center. Plenty of towels . Breakfast was very good. I would stay there again.

Summary: Convenient location in Orange County. New, clean hotel. Fresh cooked breakfast each morning. Have stayed at 3 Ayres hotels in the area, and highly recommend them.  This one is very new, and we have stayed twice in the last 6 months. Fresh baked cookies late in the afternoon are a hit!

Summary: This was our first time staying at the Ayres Hotel Orange and from the moment we walked into the lobby we were amazed how beautiful it was. The location of the Ayres Hotel Orange was perfect, in the middle of both places. We will definitely be returning and would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary: This was my family's first stay in n Ayres Hotel. A block of rooms was reserved for a wedding I attended. My experience was nothing short of excellent. When traveling in the future, I will certainly consider an Ayre's Hotel if one is in the area.

Summary: The staff was exceptional and the rooms were amazing The experience from start to finish was very so enjoyable The location was perfect with resturants and shops close by Getting on and off the highway was so easy

Summary: Great service, great breakfast room, great staff. This was perfect for our very large college lacrosse team. Everyone was welcoming and accommodating. It was extremely convenient for the boys, too. They could walk across the street to shops and restaurants. It was very easy to congregate in the large breakfast room each day, too. Staff let us use it for team lunches and dinners. They made sure we had everything we needed. We will definitely be back. The rooms were also big, too, with nice queen-sized beds. The air conditioners worked great as well.

Summary: We were in CA for the Collegiate lacrosse tourny and didn't know long we would be staying. As the boys continued to win, we continued to "extend" and spent the whole week there. The staff was very accommodating to not only the team but the parents as well. The space was pleasant and I spent one rainy day reading in a comfortable nook. The rooms were spacious, beds comfy and breakfast fresh. I would definitely recommend without hesitation.

Summary: Great hotel, accommodating our requests before we even arrived.  Christopher at the front desk moved our reservation up a day with no problem.  When I emailed the GM Allen about how great this was, he replied to my email right away stating they pride themselves on customer service, which we found to be true during our entire visit.  From the great, clean room to the filling breakfast, we enjoyed every minute.  Allen also made sure my request to have the room cleaned before noon one day was taken care of so that when we came back for our daughter's nap during the "Disney Day", everything was ready for us. Great experience all the way around which made our trip so much more enjoyable.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Perfect, perfect, perfect! Clean, quiet, and so comfortable.
Summary: i stayed here in May 2015 for business. I have to say I am glad I did. The hotel is really clean, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the amenities were fantastic. It didn't hurt that they offer a "manager's happy hour" in the evening and a free hot breakfast in the morning!!   The room was great. It was really quiet and the bed was nice and comfortable. I have nothing bad to say about the room it was perfect to relax and rest. The location, in my opinion, was perfect for me. It is within walking distance to the local mall and a number of restaurants are in striking distance. While I didn't visit the area for Disneyland, it is within a 5 minute drive. Overall, the location is great.   The staff at the hotel are super friendly and so helpful. I will definitely stay here

Summary: Everything in this new hotel was better than we expected. We were greeted very cheerfully. There were fresh made cookies and lemonade waiting at night. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was well thought out.

Summary: this was the second time staying with this hotel and i have nothing but good  to say about it.  the staff was very friendly, rooms were clean. decent breakfast in the mornings and the complimentary beverages at night added a great touch. spa and pool clean, and the staff again very helpful and courteous. close enough to take the bus to Disney.

Summary: Amazing rooms!  Huge Bathrooms and beautiful mirrors!   Had so much help from front desk girls!  Kareen and Jennifer, they helped make my stay welcoming and unforgettable. Summary: I have NO doubt I will return to this hotel! I have NO negative comments! My sister and I enjoyed the room with the half-wall separation, which enabled us to sleep more comfortably, esp when she snored in her queen bed!

Summary: Very spacious rooms with beautiful design. Largest hotel shower ever! Solid breakfast. Walking distance to the outlets and some good restaurants. Also right down the street from Angel stadium, save on parking.

Summary: We took 2 granddaughters to Disneyland.  Before going we checked reviews for several hotels.  The Ayres meet all of out needs. We would defiantly return to the  Ayres!!!!

Summary: Stayed there on a business trip ... very friendly staff, good breakfast, large and spotless rooms, very convenient location, and very quiet. Now top of my list for business hotel in Orange. It it matters, Disneyland, Crystal Cathedral (walking distance), Angels Stadium, Chapman College are all within 5 miles.

Summary: I stayed in a double queen suite for a 3 day conference and was very impressed with the service and the room. The outlets have USB ports for easy charging of phones and such. The thermostat is on the wall and electric. Kept the room perfect, but there are no instructions on how to use it. If you keep pushing the buttons it is fairly easy to figure out.  Shower was nice and big. Refrigerator is a bit small, but I was able to cram 3 days worth of food in there. Overall good experience. I will definitely come back to stay here!

Summary: The Ayres Hotel, not to be confused with the Ayres Inn, is a lovely hotel off a busy freeway and busy city. The lobby is peaceful and beautiful and the concierge staff is helpful and friendly. The room was large and comfortable with a large bed, sofa, work area with high speed Internet, large shower (other rooms are equipped with large bathtubs), microwave and refrigerator. They offer free parking and free breakfast buffet. Starbucks is right around the corner as is many fast food restaurants and gas stations. The gym offers nice equipment for both cardio and weight lifting as well as an outdoor pool. I travel a lot and I always choose the Ayres Hotel, if available, and this hotel did not disappoint.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just to clarify, this review is for the Ayres Hotel Orange on The City Drive. (It seems that some reviews don't jive with the location). I found the overall d√©cor beautiful and soothing.  I requested a quiet room and they delivered. Unlike another guest, I was not disturbed by slamming doors or outside noise. The front desk staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful; they pointed out that I could see Disney fireworks from my window, and that was a treat! Also each morning I could see the sun reflecting on the Crystal Cathedral, making it appear to be in flames. My king room was spacious, the bed and linens ultra comfortable. Everything was spotless. Lots of things included at no extra charge: A good hot breakfast buffet with plenty of choices. Wine/beer/drinks each evening in
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros:  Large clean room with very comfortable bed and lovely linens, soft pillows, and comfortable furniture, a quiet (!) refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave.  Great shower and really nice toiletries (shampoo/lotion/etc.).  Despite being right off the freeway, the windows blocked out the sound beautifully.  Free breakfast (mediocre, but available).   Cons: They use a horrible-smelling room spray.  I left my room window open all day to air it out, but the business center was almost unbearable, as there was an automatic sprayer.  Business Center computers were quite slow, until I downloaded Chrome onto one of them, which worked well.  Slamming doors and next-door sounds were loud.  The shower next door sounded like a waterfall.  Sterile lobby and relatively uninterested
Manager Response: none

Summary: After a long 19 hour drive we pull into the Ayres hotel lot and enter the lobby. My wife asks to check in and the front desk addresses my wife by name because he recognized her voice from a phone call made hours earlier while we were on the road. I knew this was gonna be a great stay. I was right. From the very spacious and UNBELIEVABLY clean room to the full bacon, eggs, and waffles included breakfast, the free beer and and soft drinks in the evening, ample free parking, free WiFi, friendly greetings all day from everyone on staff from the housekeeper to the gardener. I could go on. 2 min. drive to great outlet shopping. Great dining 10 min. radius in all directions. Blocks from the ball park. UC Irvine medical across the street. Disneyland 10 min. away. Krispy Kreme couple
Manager Response: none

Summary: I Have never heard of this hotel and booked one night to visit relatives. I wish they had more all over the U.S. Spacious rooms, large shower, all the amenities of a 5 star hotel . Bed was luscious, t.v. had a good variety of stations, I wish I could have stayed longer.
Manager Response: none

Summary: New hotel was very clean and in good condition. Jennifer Hernandez was amazing. Actually all the staff was great minus one night clerk. The rooms are large which was wonderful because I have kids. The bathtub was huge. We had 3 kids and 2 adults with no problem. The pool and jacuzzi were small but at least there was one. Free breakfast, WIFI and parking are what I always look for because I travel a lot with kids. This hotel had it all. I was very pleased. I stayed at one other Ayers hotel but the staff here made this location so much better.  They even accommodated a late check out. Centrally located and close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first trip to Anaheim, came for a hockey playoff game and were not disappointed. Hotel rooms were large and very clean, staff were friendly. Breakfast served each morning, WIFI was very good. Location of hotel was great easy access to Honda center,  Angels stadium, and disneyland, disney shuttle picks up at this location. Walking distance to "The block" or outlets at orange decent choice of restaurants and shopping to be had.  Pool area was nice and clean also had large seating area where you could have your morning coffee and relax, only downside was that parkade was right next to pool area.  Overall we were very pleased, would definately stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the best hotel experiences in Orange County.  Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms large and clean.  Loved the large shower/tub combo.  Breakfast buffet was very nice but could have used someone to clean the tables more quickly.  Sometimes hard to find a clean table to sit at.  Overall was a great experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room was very clean. Bed comfortable. Asked for top floor away from elevator and did not get it, even though I called a couple of days before. Ended up on second floor literally next to elevator! But sound proofing is very good in this hotel so we did not have to move. Staff was not very friendly. Gave the rating I did because room was spotless and quiet.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Amy!!   I contacted Amy after her stay, apologized for our error in not honoring her request, provided some compensation  and am happy to report that Amy and her family are returning to the Ayres Hotel Orange in the near future for another trip to Disneyland.  I have already pre-blocked her requested room . Amy - thank you for giving me the opportunity to rectify our error and have you back as a return guest.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Spacious rooms..Grand Slam breakfast and personable staff
Summary: When I went to the Ayres I had the intention of a one night stay; however, I had to extend my stay by almost two weeks! The friendly employees were very helpful and they all would never hesitate to be the first to give a helping hand. The rooms are new and clean and very spacious with alot of privacy! The most important item that I like about the hotel is the Almond Roca they sell in their general store located behind the front desk! It sure kept me satisfied!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a very nice hotel close to Chapman University. Clean, quite and the staff is excellent! I would not hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel to others. If my son is accepted to Chapman this will be our hotel of choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice hotel, big and shiny new rooms, delicious hot breakfast, and great service.  Very close to Disneyland, though not walking distance.  Shuttle available for a fee.  The parking is free, which is not the case with most hotels around Disneyland.  Would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: it was a very good hotel
Summary: the staff were very nice,helpful and friendlily the room was big and clean, the hotel's management has to think about adding more serviettes for breakfast meal, it is very close to Disney Land and shopping mall

Summary Heading: Smooth stay in modern, clean rooms
Summary: I stayed the hotel with friends to visit Disneyland. I enjoyed the modern style of the rooms and their amenities. I found it clean and tidy, and was pleased with the refrigerator and microwave provided. The pool was great and the hot tub was relaxing with strong jets. Customer service was good and friendly. I only saw an employee when needed (except for housekeepers in the hallways) and I love that. If I had the chance, I would stay here again.  Pros (extra nice features other than a comfortable bed and nice AC): - Refrigerator and microwave in room. - Ample bathtub. - Nice pool and hot tub. - Great cable TV signal with HBO included. - Guest laundry service. - Free and consistent high speed wireless internet. - Free breakfast. - Direct access to Anaheim Resort Transit shuttles.

Summary: This is a nice hotel that is about 4 miles from Disneyland (They also have a shuttle service for a small fee).  The hotel staff is incredibly polite and helpful.  I needed to stay an additional night and they were not only able to accommodate my request but they agreed to give me the same discounted rate that I had booked for the previous nights.  The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms are pretty clean.  The bathrooms look like they were very recently renovated (Super clean).  The carpet could have used a cleaning but I‚Äôm a bit of a germaphobe , I almost always keep house shoes on when I stay in hotels.  I wasn't too impressed with the free morning breakfast, but the evening wine reception was nice if you want to grab a glass of wine to bring up to your room and relax a

Summary: We decided to try this property as an alternative to the Ayres property on Katela, which has been our "go to" for the past several years.  We found the area to be not as busy, which suited us.  The desk staff were very helpful and friendly during check in and check out.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The housekeeping staff did a great job.  The patio area near the pool was a great place to catch up on some reading.  The breakfast met our needs, tho finding a place to enjoy it was a bit tight depending on the time.  The ART bus stops next door at the Ayers Inn.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Stay, Clean, Confortable, Quiet with Breakfast
Summary: The hotel staff were wonderful. The room was very clean. The bed was great (it's not everyday my husband and I agree on a bed that we BOTH like). It was very quiet.  This is the second Ayres hotel brand that I have stayed at.  I recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was new, reasonably priced and clean. Free parking, wifi and a great breakfast all included in your room rate. Allen the assistant manger was wonderful and super helpful to all our needs. He was so kind to my girls and always patient while they talked his ear off. We met the Manager as well who was super nice. Thanks Allen for a wonderful stay!  Amazing hotel, great location and the best service you could ask for. Thank you Ayres for a wonderful eight days! We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed two different hotels while spent a week in LA for my family to experience "Disneyland."  My family all agreed that we love and prefer Ayres over the other 4 star hotel.  The room was very spacious and the high ceiling is beautiful.  Staffs are very friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay at Ayres Hotel again on our next LA trip.

Summary: Excellent Services, the accommodations where beautiful and very clean.  The bed were very comfortable, the bathroom were very clean and very spacious.  Will recommend everyone to stay not just for business but for family vacations.

Summary: For the price I was not expecting such a high quality hotel experience.  Awesome staff, super clean, excellent beds, happy hour beers, cookies, are you kidding me???  We had a big group and they handled everything we could throw at them.

Summary: This hotel has excellent decor and great services. There is free parking, plus a parking garage in the back if the front lot runs out of space. Free fast wifi and wired internet. It's about DSL speed. The breakfast is about the same everyday: eggs, pancakes, potatoes, bacon or sausage, cereal, yogurt, fruit, and pastries. The best part is they have apple orange guava juice which is delicious! The staff is friendly and fulfills requests very quickly. The rooms are very clean and the housekeeping is excellent. This hotel is also conveniently right next to the freeway. All around great hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved the modern, clean, updated look of the hotel. The room was spacious and the high ceiling in one section made the room feel bigger. The bathtub was super large compared to other hotels. Breakfast was decent. The front desk staff could use a little more training. I called about a high pitch sound coming from the small fridge. The staff member said I would have to unplug it or wait til tomorrow since he doesn't know how to fix it. I then called again about the bathtub drain clogging up. I was given the same advice, wait til tomorrow. I had to ask for another room. Pool very small, but clean. Otherwise, we had enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review on the Ayres Hotel Orange.  Thank you for your kind comments and especially for your constructive criticism.  We are indeed continuing to train our new staff and not being able to respond to simple maintenance issues is unacceptable.  We have increased staff along with increased training on how to handle non-front desk issues after maintenance has gone home.  Again thank you for your review and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Clean rooms with a nice breakfast! Loved the hot tub and pool area. I would stay again. Parking garage is new. We stayed somewhere else a year ago and Ayers had almost everything we were looking for. Just no hotel shuttle to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Should be rated higher than 3 stars!!
Summary: I booked my room like I always do through Priceline. This time I did one of the express deals and lucked out with Ayres Hotel in Orange. The staff are great, the rooms are clean and modern, and the proximity to Disneyland is closer than you think. They have free breakfast, free wifi, free parking, and comfy beds. Definitely a must stay. Breakfast was pretty typical. The highlights were the bacon (thicker than most places) and the fresh fruit was perfect. I will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was clean and new! Bed was super comfortable the room smelled great! The downside of this place was the shuttle ! The driver ran a red light twice and went fast over a speed bump hurt my whole back i was down for a day!!!! I did complain and only got a sorry i still have a bruise on my back as well at least i got a sorry right ? Another thing i was not happy about was i couldn't take breakfast to my husband cause they don't like food going up to the rooms . Well then why have a fridge ? And food service . Good thing the manger was nice enough and let me cause my husband was not felling well to go down their and eat. I will most likely stay here again .
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for your great review, with the exception of the ART shuttle.  The hotel uses the ART shuttle as do the majority of the hotels in the Anaheim area.  The hotel has no control over ART but I have spoken to the Operations Manager for ART and passed on your comments.  We have never had any complaints about their service so I wanted to make sure that ART was aware of what happened during your ride so they could investigate the incident and their employee.  Thank you for bringing to our attention so that I could work with ART and their staff. Christine SMith

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Ayres!!
Summary: My favorite hotel to stay at in Orange County! Always friendly, reasonably priced, clean and comfortable.  Great breakfast, pool/spa area, workout room, and ample parking. Amazing location for so many major activities and events.

Summary Heading: New, clean, good size room and friendly staff
Summary: The hotel is brand new and nicely decorated.  Room is large with lots of storage so it's ideal for long term stay.  Room is equipped with small refrigerator and microwave and has laundry facilities.  Ample parking.  Breakfast is also good!  I would suggest a jar tip for breakfast staff.  Also there is a Starbucks nearby. Frontdesk staff is very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review!!  The Hotel Orange appreciates your comments and I want all guests to know that reviews are posted in all departments so that our employees can see the benefit of their hard work and guest service skills.   Christine Smith

Summary: Stayed for one night and couldn't have been happier. Rooms are clean and very very spacious. Every detail about this hotel was thought out very well. Staff was friendly and the free breakfast was way better than most free breakfasts.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price
Summary: This is a new hotel across the street from the Block at Orange and UC Irvine Medical, about 5 minutes from Disneyland. We stayed here with our kids. The rooms have a sofa sleeper, and include a microwave and refrigerator. This was perfect for a Disneyland visit with the family. The shuttle to Disneyland was reasonably convenient; driving and parking would honestly take just as much time and cost as much as the shuttle. We were very happy that everything on the room was new, parking was free and breakfast was included. Highly recommend.

Summary: I had to stay at the hotel for a family member who was having surgery at the UC Irvine Medical Center. It was very convenient, right across the street that I could walk to. They were very accommodating, had a free breakfast, very clean.
