Summary: Enjoyed our stay at this clean, efficient hotel.  Fresh hot, breakfast was great!  (Better than other chains I've stayed at.) I think I've decided it's better to stay a little farther from Disney and not pay for hotel parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights for my sons wedding. Rooms were amazing and staff the best. Booking for my family coming in from the East coast was so easy and staff could not have been more helpful.Rooms were so clean and well kept. Staff right there when we needed anything.

Summary: Stayed here for a Disneyland weekend with the family.  The hotel was beautiful, customer service was amazing. Rooms were very clean & the bed was perfect. Breakfast was good,(get there early if you want a table).  Disneyland park is the next exit off the freeway,  very convenient.

Summary: The facilities are new so nothing is worn down. Love the bed it is so comfy cozy and the pillows were super soft. Direct TV on the flat screen, the desk chair is something I want for my office. Didn't really sit on the couch but for a minute, so no comment for it.  Bar area nice, bathroom vanity was nice and bright. Lots of room for organizing your stay.  Breakfast was cooked fresh, they had pancakes, sausage, eggs, potatoes, etc.

Summary: Very convenient 7 min drive to Disneyland. Had a wonderful stay. Hot breakfast daily. It could have had a few more choices to eat but overall it was hot and tasty! The rooms are very spacious and clean. Lots of storage. Beds were comfortable. Shower was clean and spacious! Several off site restaurants in the area and a shopping mall near by. Overall great experience for 2 adults 2 children. Would stay again in a second.

Summary: Staying here was a great decision.  My work was in LAX but I wanted the opportunity to see another area.  Had a great time in Orange and was able to avoid the freeway because of the location of Ayres.  This might be a foreign concept for some people, but there is an amazing world off the freeways if you want to shop, dine, and explore new areas.  The Ayres Hotel Orange was the perfect place and lent itself to a pleasant day in a new area before heading to LAX on the freeway which was only 25 minutes on a Sunday morning. Lucky me.

Summary: Even my husband was impressed with this hotel. Very clean and elegant. Beds were very comfortable and breakfast was great as well. Definitely staying here again! One exit from Disneyland!A+ The kids had a blast.

Summary: The rooms were very spacious and clean. They offered free breakfast, free wifi in room and free parking. Most hotels don't offer any of this let alone all three. It's a beautiful new hotel and is my new "go to" hotel for our family Disneyland trips.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel last week and could not have been happier.  From the second we checked in to the second we left; everything is a 10.  Allen was amazing with his friendly attitude, helpfulness and customer service; as was the whole staff.  The rooms are large, clean and perfect in every way.  They have a great 'happy hour' in the evening to a wonderful breakfast in the morning. We will definitely stay at this property again!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your great review, we are pleased that we were able to provide great service and that your stay with us exceeded your expectations.  Thank you, and I will give a "Hooray" to Allen!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Always liked the decor of the Ayres chain.  They make them look nice, welcoming, and just a little more "posh" than your normal hotel in the same price range.  This hotel is in a good area, within 1/2 mile of the 5 freeway and the open-air Orange Mall, and only about 2 miles from Disneyland.  Beds are very firm, with a very thick pillow top pad.  Next to a busy street and close to the freeway, but quiet when windows closed up.  Free Wi-Fi at a decent speed, and the free morning breakfast is decent (bulk scrambled eggs; bacon; hash browns; assorted cereals, fruits, pastries; milk and juices.  Great place to stay if you need to be in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review for the Ayres Hotel Orange!!  WE all appreciate your kind words and hope to see you again in the near future!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: This fine property is an excellent place to stay in Orange. I visited with a large group of high school seniors from Sacramento, we spent the whole day driving down and stayed here both before and after spending a day at Disneyland, which is a short drive from the hotel. If you're headed to Disnyeland from the hotel, you'll be parked and out of your car within 10-15 minutes.   The first place most of us went after checking in was the pool and the gym. Complementary towels are provided for guests poolside, and there is a hottub which can fit 7. Both met our needs well. The gym was a little on the small side, but impressively well stocked for a small hotel like this one.   The entire property had a sort of refinement and cleanliness which was a step above what you would find in
Manager Response: Wow, your review is so appreciated!!  We love how the Hotel is able to accommodate both groups, families, leisure and business guests while maintaining the refined style your mentioned.  Thank you very much for your review!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: I stayed here because I was having surgery across the street. They gave me a rate. Very nice place. I would recommend this hotel highly. Would stay there again. It's close to Disneyland and other activities.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review.  The Ayres Hotel Orange is please to partner with UCI Medical Center and CHOC to provide special rated accommodations for guests being treated at those facilities.  We understand that not all guests are here for Disneyland and want to help make  medical visits a little easier for our UCI guests.  Again thank you!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Great for UC Irvine medical center area
Summary: I stayed here for a hand therapy course that was within walking distance. It was clean and convenient. Breakfast was good. There is a small fitness center and small outdoor pool/hot tub that I didn't have time to sample.

Summary: Serving HOT breakfast, free parking right infront of the door, and having washer and dryer in each floor was a plus.also, it has a nice huge outlet right behind it ( 5 min walking). However, it does not have glass cups for the complementary tea and coffee. And you have to help yourself to get any extra paper cups or even the trolley for the luggage. One of The front disk people was friedly but not helpful, not sure if it was him or generally thats the way the are

Summary: Nice clean and comfortable hotel near many attractions. Staff were friendly and amenities were ample. Especially liked having directv in the room. Close to several attractions including Disney and Angels stadium. Not too far of a drive to the coast.

Summary: Very nice newer hotel. large rooms, nice layout, comfortable bed. Overall extremely well equipped hotel fitness center that was never crowded when I worked out thursday to monday afternoons. Extremely clean because it is new, hopefully they will keep it that way, and will quickly repair or replace equipment that is broken, or disappears.  -Outdoor pool is small and unfortunately not

Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Initially, I noticed the calm and serene decor. The lobby and my room were well attended to.  It even smelled fantastic!  The hallways are nicely wide, colorful and bright so you didn't feel herded down a path. The little details made me feel well cared for including free and fresh cookies, oranges and fruit infused water in the lobby. The free breakfast was great and didn't consist of just hard boiled eggs and oatmeal!   (We're talking bacon, eggs, hash browns, pancakes, fruit and more!)  The staff was friendly and helpful and took pride in their surroundings. One thing that I would've appreciated in my room was a list of local eateries within walking distance, etc.  I was attending a conference and was without a vehicle and options for dinner

Summary Heading: This place will become the Orange County/Disneyland GO-TO Place
Summary: I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim on a number of occasions and there number one ranking in the Anaheim area is well deserved.  For this trip with my GF we decided to try out the new Ayres Hotel Orange. This place just recently opened back in the fall of last year.  It still smells new and when we got there by the look of the parking lot the hotel was not that occupied. One thing to note--The Ayres Inn Orange is the older one.  The Ayres Hotel Orange is the newer one which this review is for.    When we arrived we were greeted by Allen who was pleasant and made the check in process a very easy and quick one. The layout is fairly similar to the Ayres Hotel Anaheim and the rooms are about the same size. We had a king room and the bathroom and shower was huge.  Great water

Summary: Everything was just fine except that the television remote did not work.  We went to the front desk for help.  We called maintenance for help.  No help ever arrived.  Nor a new remote.  (We were there 3 days.  We sought help the first day.)  It was disappointing.

Summary Heading: 4 miles from Disneyland but easier to get to Disney than closer hotels
Summary: First, a very nice new hotel.  Well run and all is new.  For folks going to Disneyland.  Simple - leave the car (Free parking) at hotel.  Take the shuttle.  Only cost $3 round trip per day.  2 stops (roughly 12 minutes away).  First stop is at Convention Center and the shuttle drops you off right in front of Disneyland.  Route 14  The hotel is nicely situated near a shopping area (just a few blocks away - South).  It's also right next to the UC Medical Center.  Breakfast is provided which very nice.    The Hotel is nice, roomy and has all the features for those traveling.  Pool, gym, and mini guest store.

Summary: This hotel team gladly went above and beyond.   It felt like clean, nice rooms and friendly staff were their baseline - and they aimed to exceed your expectations.   I had a number of requests that required extra effort from the Ayres team and they happily helped out to make sure they took care of me.  One of the most consistent hotel experiences I've had in a while.  They genuinely earned a top rating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful new hotel with Asian theme lobby.  Allen at the front desk was very courteous and helpful. The room was spacious and clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  Minor gripes - I wished the cookies served in the early evening were warm and moist as they were in another Ayres we stayed at. Also, my sister was at another Ayres at the same time and they had bacon and sausage every day, ours only had bacon or sausage per day.  The Styrofoam plates for breakfast did the job but wished it was paper and compostable or recyclable.  Did love the compostable cups.  Tips- Remember to request a tub if you need one, we have a child and wished we had but decided to stay with the shower stall which was super big and clean.  Also, the Jacuzzi in the pool area was turned off, I couldn't find

Summary: Excellent hotel in great proximity to the UCI Medical Center and the Outlet Malls in Orange. The free breakfast was amazing, freshly prepared and very tasty. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. ONLY drawback I found to this hotel was the lack of a courtesy shuttle.

Summary: The rooms are comfortable and beautiful with contemporary decor. The breakfast area is decorated nicely; but the food choices are pretty limited i.e., scrambled eggs only, instant oatmeal.  Short walking distance to the Outlets at Orange where lots of good restaurants and shopping can be found.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Ayers Hotel in Orange comes highly recommended from our family. The staff was professional and the rooms/accommodations were way above expectations. The hotel offers a great breakfast buffet that helps get you going in the morning. With 2 little ones accompanying us, this really made things easier as the quality of the food was great. We also utilized the swimming pool and hot tub. I will say in February they need to crank up the heating on the pool as it was too cold to stay in. The hot tub was perfect though. Conveniently next door at the Ayers Inn were were able to pick up a shuttle to Disneyland. All in all I would stay here again in a heartbeat and will recommend it to friends and family if they are going to Disneyland or a convention down in the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Great deal, just needs a few small improvements to make it excellent!
Summary: I would give a 3.5 star review if I could.  We stayed here this last weekend for 2 nights (Fri and Sat).    PROS: Updated appearance throughout (lobby, rooms, pool area were all beautiful), clean rooms, nice water pressure in the shower, fitness center had great equipment and plenty of room to use, relatively quiet, close to the freeway for easy access, free & fast wi-fi, close parking to the lobby, free cookies & oranges/apples in the lobby at all times, comfortable beds and large rooms.  CONS: Staff wasn't super friendly, the free breakfast in the morning was terrible quality, the coffee in the room and at breakfast was the worst I've ever had, the workout room didn't have any towels or antibacterial wipes to clean equipment with.  Overall, I would definitely stay here again

Summary: This hotel is beyond amazing! Most delicious fully cooked breakfast with eggs, bacon, sausage and really cute mickey mouse shaped pancakes! Perfect for the Disney theme! Rooms are very nice, beds super cozy after a long day at the park. Loved the cookies in the afternoon. Quite the treat. Wish they would give a couple in room when we are gone, or longer in the evenings.  Shuttle comes every 15 minutes and you are at Disney within minutes. Aaron provided excellent customer service.

Summary: When I walked in I was blown away beautiful hotel, and then I got to my room and I kept telling my husband this is the nicest place we have ever stayed , the bed was amazing best sleep I've had in years .  Thank you for a wonderful experience :D

Summary: Clean, comfortable stay. Orange

Summary: Our stay was an excellent stay and it is a clean and wonderful hotel. Great full breakfast, friendly helpful staff. I would definitely stay again and highly recommend! Starbucks right next door...yea!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel close to Orange Outlets
Summary: The hotel was within walking distance to the Orange Shopping Outlets.  The Honda Center was approximately 2 miles away. The free continental breakfast was very good with fresh scrambled eggs and hot pancakes.  The room was very spacious and clean. Plenty of towels. Wifi worked well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel and location itself was fine. The front desk wonderful. General manager, "Christine" rude beyond belief. I paid for a late check out at 3 pm. At precisely 3 pm I get a call from "Christine" asking me to check-out and come downstairs to pay my bill. My bill was already paid. She ended the call by telling me it was 3 pm. Thanks, Christine, I can tell time. It was not 3:05,3:10 or heaven forbid 3:30.. No I got the call at 3 pm. To add insult to injury, when I got downstairs, the poor clerk look dumbfounded and said I really didn't need to do anything though he did ask if I wanted a receipt. I didn't. I could see my card was already charged the night before.  For a hotel that prides itself on "giving the royal treatment" I felt like the staff. I will not return again
Manager Response: Dear Guest I am sorry that you felt you were disrespected my me; I unfortunately do not remember the conversation going as you stated,  I did call the room at 3 pm to ask if you would be checking out as we often have late checkouts decide to stay an additional night.  We also call so that we can update the Housekeeping department.  I spoke to you as I do all guests, in a polite and cordial and respectful manner; as I understand that our guests are why we have our jobs.  I am very sorry you viewed our brief communication in a negative manner.   Christine Smith  General Manager

Summary: the service was top notch. our experience with the hotel and front desk was the best I have yet to experience. the rooms were clean and the amenities were unexpected. will definitely stay here again. thank you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A new Good hotel Perfectly stay.  The staff was so cooperating . the breakfast was not so good i will give it fine.       The manager was no nice  also was all the staff so  friendly  a nice hotel with a good location near to disney land and orange outlet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for a business meeting and was very surprised at the quality and special touches to the hotel.  We normally stay in the Irvine/Orange area and this is definitely the best.  Tons of nice touches- cookies at night, a glass of free wine in the evening, lovely lobby where you actually want to stay and sip your wine.  My daughter goes to Chapman University that is located in Orange and this will be my go to hotel.  I've booked all my families room for her May graduation.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review, I am so pleased you enjoyed the Ayres Hotel Orange.  We will continue to work hard to retain our #1 ranking on Trip Advisor and provide the great service and quality of product for our guests.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: This is a very new hotel in Orange which is about a 3.5 mile drive to Disneyland and next door to some incredible shopping at the Outlet Mall...beautiful rooms and great people working at the desk...I will be staying there again next year upon our return to Anaheim
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for your review and support.  I appreciate you acknowledging our great location; close to the Outlets of Orange as well as Disneyland.  Hope to see you on your next trip out this way!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Everything you can ask for from a hotel and more.
Summary: Me and my wife were looking for a quick getaway and Ayres delivered.From the front desk service to the quality and cleanliness of the room it was perfect. Great location close to the fwy and one of our favorites restaurants Lucilles was just a walk away. We look forward to coming back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved my stay here. It's a very nice hotel, great complimentary breakfast, and comfy beds. Amazing shopping center within walking distance.Only thing that kept this from 5 star is there is no kitchenette. Overall great experience!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lovely room!  Great breakfast!  Well run hotel!  The room  had two double beds with a small wall between them giving a little more privacy.  We went there for an event at Chapman University, not exactly close, but not too far.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was very friendly and we felt welcomed when we arrived. We loved the decor...it had a modern and exquisite touch to it.   The breakfast was delicious also.I had about 4 pieces of crisp and tasty bacon.  The room was clean and tidy and very spacios.I big tub was a plus also.
Manager Response: none

Summary: While I didn't stay at this property as I was a guest a the sister property, Ayres Inn, next door.  I did pay the property a visit.  Simply described as elegant and beautiful; complete with a friendly and gracious staff.  The front desk associate was welcoming and took the time to tell me about the new property and the differences between properties as well as, give me a tour of one of the well appointed suites.   The Ayres Hotel Orange has now been added to me list of properties to use when I have my next getaway. The suites are large and roomy and the hotel offers free parking, breakfast and wifi. And let's not for the evening cocktail reception in the lobby to wash away a long day.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great, New Hotel with Exceptional Service
Summary: This is a hidden gem of a hotel.  It's one of those places that you'd hope to keep secret from the rest of the world, because you don't want them to build up a large clientele base and start going downhill.  It's practically brand spanking new and offers exceptional value and friendly service.  In short, it has just about everything you'd need with the exception of in-room [food] service and safe.   They do have a safe at the front desk, though.    They even offer complementary breakfast and [self]parking.     Highly recommended; especially, if you're more into great value and comfort at an accessible price, instead of expensive luxury.  P.S. Not to be mistaken with the Ayres Inn Orange (next door).
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised at the over-all quality of the hotel, room and service since this was one of the less expensive hotels offered in the Anaheim by my travel company. Great bang for the buck. I would stay at an Ayres Hotel in the future based on my experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wife and I had a an unexpected 2 days off so we had an unexpected journey to Disneyland! We have stayed at the other Ayers Orange County properties but never at this new one..Did not dissapointi at all. Property is new and zen like in decor. Rooms are spacious and the shower is huge. Parking free. Wifi and hot breakfast free as well made for a great stay. Plenty of parking and staff friendly and welcoming
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: New, very clean, good for both families and business travelers.
Summary: Nice facilities. Seems like it would be great for families with free breakfast, pool etc. However, as biz traveler I asked for quiet room and got it. Place is brand new. My room was modern and roomy. The bathtub was gigantic. I would go again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As always, Ayres delivers on customer service, cleanliness, and hospitality.  This Ayres Hotel in Orange is a newer property with a more modern motif.  We enjoyed the "style" of this property as much as the more traditional/European look of the other properties.  We stayed in a King room with a kitchenette and really appreciate the actual counter space of the kitchenette as opposed to the cabinet type kitchenette of Ayres Inn in Orange (the smaller Inn next to the Hotel on Chapman Ave.).  It was so much easier to prepare my food (I bring my own due to food restrictions) every morning than trying to prepare it at the Ayres Inn with no counter space.  We will, most likely, book at the Ayres Hotel more often in the future due to the upgraded kitchenette.    The furniture,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Sophisticated, crisp, clean, comfortable, quiet, convenient. We booked a good rate in the off-season, but even at the regular rate, it's a fine place to stay. Best breakfast too, if they add more fresh fruit options--simple whole apples and bananas would do it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved everything!!! It was somewhere I've never heard of & will be back to stay! The breakfast in the morning was awesome, staff was on top of everything & very friendly! It was close to all of the attractions & malls!
Manager Response: Dear Guest - Thanks for the great review and especially noting our staff.  We appreciate your kinds words and will see you in the future! Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We satayed six nights and got almost everything we need, rate is fair and square , breakfast is included , rooms are well furnished clean and tidy, staff very cooperative and friendly , availability of heated swimming pool and a gym, the hotal is close to an outlet with wide variety of shops also to UCI Hospital, we honestly enjoyed our stay and would recommend without hesitation .
Manager Response: Dear Guest - Thank you for your "awesome' review of the Ayres Hotel Orange, I really appreciate the time you took to let us know how we did!!    Christine Smith Ayres Hotel Orange

Summary Heading: JUST out of the wrapper NEW!
Summary: This is a great place to stay while visiting our kids at Chapman University.  Super fresh and new, with unique decor.  The staff always gets high marks and never fails to follow-up on any issues that may arise.  Pretty standard breakfast fare, which we generally skip, but the cafe area is inviting and well-kept just the same.  A definite cut above other Ayres properties!
Manager Response: Dear Chapman Parent - Thank you for your kind review, we love our Chapman parents and hope to establish a four year relationship while your kids attend Chapman University.  The Ayres Family is a strong supporter of Chapman University both by financially supporting special programs at the University as well as extending a special rate for Chapman parents.  Again thank you!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel across the street from UC-Irvine Med Center
Summary: Our first impression when we walked into the lobby and then into our hotel room was that the hotel must have just opened for business.  Our room didn't look like anyone had ever stayed there.  It was immaculate.  The coffee maker in the room didn't work (it looked like it had never been used).  The beds are not particularly comfortable.  Not horrible.  They've got some kind of unusual "pad" under the fitted sheet (presumably to protect the bedding) that feels like cardboard.  It bunches up very easily (I toss and turn a lot at night), and it's not at all pleasant to sleep on.  They provide several large bed pillows that are very nice.  The room was large.  There's plenty of room to spread your stuff out.  The closet area (no door) is kind of strange -- low to the ground and
Manager Response: Dear Guest - Thank you for your review and your kind words.  I did want to let you and others know that we know we have a problem with our mattress pads.  We are currently working with the manufacturer to replace all our new mattress pads due to your and many other guest comments about how they shift around under the sheets.  Please bear with us, we have 50% of our rooms with new replacement pads and are awaiting the remainder.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Brand new, very clean and comfortable, with free parking and wifi! Check in staff were friendly and helpful.  The fitness room is large and clean, and I had it to myself both mornings I was there.  Breakfast was a bit crowded, but nothing to complain about.  Very pleasant place to stay near UCI Medical Center and Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Guest  Thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you for taking the time to write a great review about the new Ayres Hotel Orange.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: It was a great hotel, checking in and out was so easy, the complimentary breakfast was amazing and the hotel room itself was just spectacular! I had a king room and the bed was so comfortable! Overall it was really great I will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were very well appointed, brand new, very clean and with everything anyone would want in a hotel room.  The decor was delightful as were all of the staff we came into contact with.  I can very comfortably recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the best!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean hotel, great decor, great location, and everything was new.  We would definitely choose this hotel again.  Close to Disneyland and the other theme parks in Anaheim.  Free parking onsite.  We really enjoyed the comfortable beds and our stay overall at the hotel.  Breakfast was included and they had happy hour drinks/cookies.  The only thing that was not so good was the quality of the fare at breakfast and the promptness of the staff in cleaning the area for guests as there were many guests turning over during breakfast time.  The mixed fruit for example tasted as if it was stored too long.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for a 2-day Disneyland trip.   These were must-have for us:  1. Free and covered parking for car - other "resorts" charge for parking.  2. Free wi-fi - other "resorts" charge for wi-fi.  3. Free microwave and refrigerator -  other "resorts" charge for these appliances.  4. Easy access to Disneyland. ART shuttles pick up and drop residents at their next door sister property Ayres Inn every 1/2 hr (bus no. 14). $5 adult and $2 children - ticket can be bought at reception of Ayres Inn.   Good to have: 1. Free complementary breakfast is basic - we managed with cereal and juices. However, still good to have.  2. New, clean gym.  3. Laundry facility (coin-operated).  4. Ice machine.   We utilized all of the above.   Other than these perks, hotel is new and is
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything is brand new! I loved this hotel. When I walked into my room you could still smell that new scent coming out of everything from the carpet to the furniture. As for the room itself it was very spacious. The bathtub in the bathroom is massive! The bed sheets are a little stiff but I figured it was because they're brand new. Bed was also a little on the firmer side. The only real complaint was at check in and the only reason I catch these things is because I've been in customer service/sales management for over 15+ years. Rodrigo, the person who checked me in was not very friendly. Very monotone like the Clear Eyes guy. Couldn't even get one smile out of him. Believe it or not, smiles do go a long way. Didn't really bother me much but with a nice hotel like this it
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very nice place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Our destination was disneyland. This hotel is away from the actual hustle and bustle of disney and yet for in the neighborhood. We were able to drive to disney in about 10 mins. The beds were definitely comfy. The room was maintained clean. We didn't try the free breakfast and hence no comments on that. We requested room service and they can in less than 5 mins and at night!!!   Some suggestions though: 1. The pillows were only down pillows. Would have been nice to have foam pillows.   We will not look for another place in the Disneyland vicinity unless Ayres becomes dreadful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved our visit!  Already booked another stay!
Summary: We stayed here 2 different visits within the week!  It was great both times!  The rooms were wonderful ....beds comfy and great internet!  It was close to shopping and the front desk was very helpful.  We visit Orange numerous time a years...this our new favorite!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was incredible!! The rooms were big and clean and very comfortable.  The free breakfast was great!! Not just pastries, donuts, and cereal; there was a chef there making fresh eggs, pancakes, and hash browns.  The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly.  The location was perfect, close to Disneyland, Angels Stadium, and UC Irvine Medical Center. Parking was free, wifi was free and they had special rates for people who were there because they were in town to get treated at UC Irvine Medical Hospital. That was the purpose of our trip, and it made the outpatient surgery easier.  After the surgery, we just drove across the street to our clean and comfy room to recover a little more before attempting the long drive home. We have done this twice now and plan to do it again
Manager Response: none

Summary: I travel often for vacation and business matters and I have to say this is one of the most comfortable hotels I have stayed at. Their customer service above average. The rooms and the hotel is spotless, very clean! Thank you guys for your service!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed 12/7/14 - 12/12/14. The hotel was new and the rooms were large and clean. Upon check-in, they were a bit delayed with having our room ready, but had cold beverages on hand while we waited. The free breakfast, free Wi-Fi, and free parking were all great and made this a great deal. We visited Disney Resort via ART transportation and it was very easy and convenient. Overall a great stay. I look forward to staying here in the future! Also, our room was very quiet, and we did not even hear of any guests coming and going.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just a one day get away from the Holiday rush and to shop at the Outlets at Orange.  The stay was brief but I will be back to stay for a longer visit. Friendly staff clean grounds clean rooms. Beds and pillows awesome! Quite!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything is just so lovely!!! Friendly customer service!!! I did not hear any peep from any other rooms. So quiet. Plus their breakfast the next day is just great!!! I loved how you share your table with others. You end up meeting interesting people.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel With a Wonderful Ambiance
Summary: This is a great hotel that is very conveniently located in the O.C. with very quick access to several Freeways. The hotel is very new and has all the modern conveniences. The bedding is extremely comfortable and the staff is very accommodating.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you very much for staying at the new Ayres Hotel Orange!  I appreciate you taking the time to review us, and we hope to see you again in the future.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: I found this hotel through Hotwire. The hotel site has a Live Chat option if you are unable to find specific info you need. I was able to get info about the ART shuttle and the shuttles that go to the hotel from LAX. The hotel is so newly built that the shuttle drivers don't really know where it is even if it is on their lists, so be sure you have the address handy if you need to assure them.   The lobby is small, but very cozy looking. There is a small pantry there where you can buy waters, snacks, and some essentials you might have forgotten. The staff are very nice and will give you directions for anywhere you might need to go. The complimentary breakfast was very good and included scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes, potatoes, and pastries. They also offered cereals, juice,
Manager Response: Dear Guests Thank you for taking the time to review the Ayres Hotel Orange, I was pleased to see how happy you were with the Hotel!  In regards to the bathroom door opening out I share your feeling, it does get in the way.  Unfortunately being a new hotel, the bathroom door opening out is a new building code requirement that we had to follow.  Again, thank you and we hope to see you back in the future!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: This is a brand new hotel in Orange. it was designed with beautiful decor. I loved the comfortable beds. The breakfast was really good as well. Helpful staff and great house keeping. I will be staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, many thanks for your review.  I am happy to ear you will be staying with us again in the future!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We LOVED our stay at the Ayres Hotel Orange this weekend.  Easy to make reservations and all the staff were helpful, professional, and friendly.  My husband thought the breakfast was wonderful--fully loaded!!!  It is tastefully decorated, very roomy everywhere you go, the spa was a hit with our grandson, and it is so close to many Orange County highlights.  We will definitely stay again and recommend it to others!
Manager Response: Thank you, thank you, thank you for your wonderful review of the Ayres Hotel Orange!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Freeway close to everything in Orange County.
Summary: The Ayres Hotel was a wonderful, clean, convenient, and economical way to visit relatives over Thanksgiving holiday.  The rooms were spacious and had to pull double pane windows for sound isolation. Breakfast was good and the staff at the hotel was courteous and present.  What more can you ask?
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: excellent place to stay with family!
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and it was an awesome experienced! We definitely recommend and stay again in this hotel the next time we have our holiday! Very convenient to Disneyland and of course a great walking distance to the Orange county outlet!!  Thanks for the great service "Ayres Hotel Orange" staff!
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing the Ayres Hotel Orange.  Yes our location is very convenient to Disneyland, Anaheim Stadium, and the Outlets of Orange.  Hope to see you in the future!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We chose this hotel due to the proximity to Disneyland. We were pleasantly surprised at how huge the rooms were...probably 50% bigger than standard sized rooms. The room was nice appointed, and the wifi was free and fast. There was free parking and breakfast, while nothing special was satisfying.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Place - Wonderful Breakfast and stay
Summary: We have stayed at 2 Ayres Hotels in the last couple weeks and both were wonderful experiences.  Having a hot breakfast, great staff, upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, large showers and tubs and larger than average rooms made both stays a wonderful experience.  We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Guest So happy to hear you have enjoyed your "stay" experiences at several Ayres Hotels.  Should your visits continue please sign up for the Ayres Rewards Program (you may have already done so), where you can accumulate points towards future FREE stays at Ayres Hotels.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We liked the hotel,it`s brand new,great style.The room was super clean ,stylish.Probably cleanest hotel ever saw.Staff is very friendly and helpful.I think the best stay ever had.Definitely recommended .
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a fantastic hotel, the staff was very accommodating, we had a company meeting here. Rooms are very nice, Loved the tub also.  Keep up the great job with your Hotels,  Waiting for the new one in Paso Robles to open, staying in a villa on a vineyard with the wine and view, can't wait to be there.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a great review for the Ayres Hotel Orange.  And yes, I'm with you, I can't wait to stay at our newest Hotel located in Paso Robles, to open in Spring 2015.  It has been named the Allegretto Vineyard Resort by Ayres and will be beautiful!    Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: The hotel was clean and quiet which made it a delightful place to stay. The staff was very friendly and helped me since I was unfamiliar with the area. The hotel is close to shipping, dining and Disney and it was easy to get to from the freeway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a very comfortable stay... I have always enjoyed staying at the Ayres Hotels... So charming and comfortable.... The staff is so pleasant and helpful ...the evening attendant even remembered my name the following morning...I believe his name was Depi...(not sure) but he was so welcoming on my late arrival. The Ayres Hotel will always be my first choice!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were in town to do a business workshop that was held at the hotel as well.  The staff was incredible.  They were very accommodating and friendly. The location was very convenient to Disneyland and within 30 minutes of the beach.  The traffic in the immediate area was very manageable.   Downtown Orange was very quaint and had wonderful options for dining. We will stay here next time we are in Orange, CA.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean, big room and staff is very friendly. If you like a hard mattress, then you will like this hotel. I prefer a softer mattress. At the breakfast station you can get an omelette or if you are in a hurry, they had scrambled eggs, bacon and potatoes ready to go.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I unknowingly made reservations at the wrong Ayres hotel and had to switch to the Orange County location upon arriving in Southern CA.  Allen (the Assistant General Manager) was so kind and helpful in getting this taken care of so we could relax and enjoy our vacation.  The hotel is beautiful.  The breakfast is free and delicious.  There is an ART shuttle to and from the hotel to Disney.  We will stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was clean and comfortable the only complaint I had was it is far from the parks (there is a bus) but if you miss it it's a hour and a half walk. But other than that it was my favorite hotel I've stayed at in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of the newly opened Ayres Hotel Orange!  The ART bus which runs to Disneyland does leave every 30 minutes, so there is always another to hop on.  Coming back from Disneyland the bus runs until 45 minutes after the closing of the park.  Again thank you and we hope to see you on your next trip to the Anaheim/Orange area. Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres Hotel three times now and have had a very good experience all three times. Very friendly staff and nice clean rooms. Great breakfast. Easy access to Disneyland by taking the ART bus..
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved the hotel-clean, great huge tub, lots of shelves in addition to drawers, nice pool, breakfast was wonderful and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The location was good. - we used the ART shuttle to get to Disney.  Free parking was a bonus! We were surprised and delighted to get chips and salsa every evening and our grand children were excited about the yummy sugar and chocolate chip cookies. Ayers is our favorite - thanks to getawaytoday.com for making the hotel arrangements for us!!!
Manager Response: I am so glad you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you for the kind words.  We just started our complimentary Hospitality Hour Monday - Thursday; serving beer, wine, sodas and snacks.  Along with our complimentary parking and WIFI access, and large rooms we really feel we provide the value for the price you pay.  We hope you are able to return with your grandchildren next year.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We booked a three day stay for taking the kids to Disneyland and we could not be happier with our visit. The staff was friendly and attentive. The rooms were large and had all the conveniences you could want or need - refrigerator, microwave, coffemaker, plenty of closet and drawer space. They are a green hotel which is great so the electricity only works if you place your hotel key in a holder when you walk in. I have stayed at hotels before like this who have neglected to tell me about it and it took another trip downstairs to figure out why the lights wouldn't turn on. Immediately at check in they tell you what to do so there is no confusion.   The beds and linens were extremely comfortable. Even the pull out sofa bed was comfortable as well. There were plenty of channels on
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write such a comprehensive review!  As the Ayres Hotel Orange is a new hotel, your review helps us get the word out that we are open and a quality hotel in the Anaheim/Orange area.  Again, thank you.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: New hotel. Modern decor. VERY spacious room and bathroom. Large shower/tub combo.  Small closet, so if you have a lot of clothes to hang, it could be an issue. Small fridge and microwave. Breakfast area is large. The usual items were offered. Front desk personnel very knowledgeable. Had an issue with pricing, but it was was resolved quickly. All staff is nice. Special mention to Christopher Cruz at the front desk. Hotel in good location. About 6 min to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Kids loved the room, It was very spacious, clean, front desk staff was great, and the breakfast was great. Only 10 mins from Disneyland at most. I would stay again. I loved the microwave and fridge, and the closet space. We had a desk, two closets, very large bathroom, a table and the double beds have a semi wall so it feels like two rooms. We enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Ayres Hotel was recommended to me by a friend, so this is where we booked our stay for our first trip to Disneyland! It was just me and my son looking to have no worries and a good time. This hotel was excellent. Very kind staff, beautiful accommodations (I'm picky about where I stay) and the breakfast was hot and plentiful before our days at Disneyland! The bathrooms were very roomy with a nice, huge bathtub for my son to play in before bed after a long, dirty day at the park! I will stay here every time I visit Disney and I highly recommend it to you all. Parking is free and right in front of the place...no walking in weird, far away alleys like some of the other places. About 1 mile from the park and it is a very easy street drive there...Also there is a microwave and
Manager Response: Dear Guest I remember your son, he was so fun to talk to in the breakfast room and lobby.  Thank you for posting your review, we really feel we are a great hotel for families visiting the Park as well as our corporate and UCI guests.  Hope you make the trip an annual event and if so, see you next year!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Great new hotel, watch the prices
Summary: A very clean, new, nicely furnished hotel.  We stayed because it was close to Disneyland and it didn't charge for parking.  We took the ART to get to Disneyland and it picked us up at the hotel and  it took only a few minutes to get to Disneyland.  The beds were comfortable and the rooms were nicely furnished.  We enjoyed the breakfast and loved that they made the eggs and pancakes right in front of you.  The only problem we faced was the price.  The girl that checked us in tried to charge us $30 more per night than my confirmation of the reservation.  We stayed with a group that booked five rooms and this happened to all five of us.  The manager was very helpful and resolved the situation but it took me two tries before I was able to speak with the manager.  Other than that we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean, new, quiet and nice large room on the corner. Laundry room on same floor helpful.  Breakfast buffet included- above average, nice room, but get there after the crowd of families hits it and the pans are refilled with fresh eggs and pancakes.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you so much for your kind words, we appreciate you taking the time to post this review, we look forward to having you back as a guest in the future! Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: I was more than pleasantly surprised at my stay at the ayres hotel.
Summary: I had never heard of the " ayres hotel" and I was a lil concerned. I was wanting a nice place to stay as I was meeting my daughter to go to Disneyland. The location and accommodations well exceeded my expectations and not only would I stay again, I'd stongly recommend to friends and family.... 2 thumbs way up!!!
Manager Response: I am so pleased that you first tried the Ayres Hotel Orange and then had a great stay!  Our close location to Disneyland and that we are part of the ART shuttle program to Disneyland is one of the reasons we are becoming a favorite family Hotel.  Thank you! Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel close to disney if you have a car
Summary: Great hotel. Very nice rooms easy off 5. Breakfast provided every morning with nice selection included. Parking was not extra as it is at many hotels in SoCal  clean modern rooms. They also have a little area selling snacks and sundries. No restaurant on site but one next door and a Wendy's close as well.
Manager Response: Thank you Guests for choosing and staying at the Ayres Hotel Orange.  Your warm review is appreciated!  Yes, our proximity to Disneyland, the Outlets of Orange, local restaurants and of course our neighborhood Starbucks makes us a great please to stay when visiting the City of Orange, Anaheim and Disneyland! Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Spent 3 nights at the Ayres Hotel Orange, while visiting daughter at college.  Rooms and facilities are very nice-virtually brand new and nicer than the other 5 Ayres i have stayed in.   Check in was ugly and had I not stayed about 40 nights at other Ayres properties I would have left.  The front desk person was Rodrigo and he was about as fast and efficient and a turtle with a brick on his back.  I gave him my AmEx (also in my Ayres profile) and could not get the card to run.  He said he could not get the card to go through--I asked him to run it again and again no luck.  He rudely stated that I needed to provide another card or we could not check in.  Although, I carry numerous cards I use certain cards for different purposes. As I gave him my Platinum Visa he stated that they
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for taking the time to write a review, your comments are very important for us as a new hotel to continue to improve our service.  Yes, the hotel did have a problem processing your credit card, our server was down and it took us a few minutes to contact our IT department to have the server rebooted.  I apologize that an explanation was not provided to you as to why the difficulty was occurring.  The hotel is new with new employees to the Hotel industry and our training program will continue.   Great Guest Service is our ultimate goal and focus. Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We stayed for only one night at the Ayres Hotel in Orange and all I can say is WOW... great location, very clean, modern, with a fabulous breakfast.  Overall great value for anyone travelling to the Anaheim area.  The staff was friendly and assisted us with early check in which was greatly appreciated.  The room size was perfect and the bathroom much larger than anticipated with a walk in shower rather than bathtub.  We would highly recommend anyone to stay here as it was great value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were originally booked at Ayres Inn next door to this hotel. On arrival from the UK and after 11.00 pm we were told they had no booking for us even though we had e-mail confirmation. They gave us a voucher for 1 night at Ayres Hotel next door as the Inn had no available rooms.  After a sleepless night worrying where we would be staying for the rest of our 13 nights in Orange visiting family we spoke to Allen, the AGM at the Ayres Hotel who sorted everything out for us and we spent the whole of our 13 nights at this lovely new hotel and they even honoured the original price we were quoted.  Lovely new/clean hotel, friendly staff, free Wi-Fi, parking and breakfast included in the price.  The only thing that let this place down was that they had no eggs on the last day of our
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm in California at least 10 times a year, and I always stay at an Ayres hotel. I recently found out that Ayres opened up a new hotel in Orange. The hotel is very clean, and the rooms are spacious. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Loved the decor throughout the room and the hotel. The gym was great, and I loved that the pool and hot tub were handicap accessible. The location is great as well. They are conveniently located right off I-5. Although the hotel is located right off the freeway I did not have to deal with any noise issues. I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We all had a great time.  The hotel staff were very nice and our check in was fast.  We had 4 rooms that were all on the same floor and across from each other -- so we didn't have to bug anyone.  Love the decor, cookies and breakfast.  We used the gym and pool and will be returning next for the LAA Baseball games.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: great place for a great price
Summary: I booked a room the night before my wedding and management and all staff were wonderful.  They fully accomadated my needs and the hotel was very nice; clean, great decor and very attentive staffing. Breakfast (which is included) exceeded my expectations.  Hot and fresh and a variety of different breakfast options with a very spacious dining room.
